the third stage adapter is lowered into place over the Lunar Module during stacking in the VAB
Apollo 13 astronauts practice ALSEP deployment at KSC. Working with the ALSEP central station are prime commander Jim Lovell (cneter) and his backup John Young (on right with back to camera)
Apollo 13 astronauts practice ALSEP deployment at KSC. Left to right: Charlie Duke (backup LMP), Vance Brand (support crew) and Fred Haise (prime LMP) are discussing procedures

Apollo 13 command service module being moved to integrated workstand for final mate to spacecraft launch adapter.

Apollo 13 space vehicle atop mobile launcher.

The original Apollo 13 crew included Ken Mattingly who was later replaced by Jack Swigert after being exposed to possible infection
Portrait of original Apollo 13 prime crew Command Module Pilot Thomas K. Mattingly II
Astronauts Lovell (left) and Haise carry out a simulation of a lunar traverse at Kilauea, Hawaii, site
Lovell (right) and Haise carry out a simulation of a lunar traverse at Kapoho, Hawaii, site
Apollo 13 astronauts stand by to participate in water egress training in a water tank in bldg 260 at the Manned Spacecraft Center
Fred Haise participates in water egress training in a water tank in bldg 260 at the Manned Spacecraft Center
Apollo 13 astronaut Thomas K. Mattingly II, command module pilot, during water egress training in a water tank at JSC.

Haise participates in lunar surface simulation training at the Manned Spacecraft Center. Haise is attached to a Six Degrees of Freedom Simulator.  Using mock-ups, he simulates traversing with the two subpackages of the ALSEP via a barbell mode
Haise participates in lunar surface simulation training at the Manned Spacecraft Center. Haise is attached to a Six Degrees of Freedom Simulator

During EVA training exercises at KSC, Jim Lovell documents the ALSEP after deployment.  The Central Station and RTG are reflected in his visor

view of the lunar lander training vehicle

The Lovell Family:   Barbara (age 16), Marilyn, Jeffrey (age 3), Jim, and Susan (age 11).  Son Jay (age 15) was a student at St. John's Military Academy in Wisconsin and wasn't present for the photo session.

George Killmer, KSC Public Affairs Office, presenting giant birthday card to astronaut James A. Lovell, Jr.

Fred Haise in the LM simulator
Apollo-13 commander Jim Lovell descends stairway of command module simulator at KSC.
Apollo 13 command module backup pilot, John L. Swigert, Jr.

Apollo 13 lunar module pilot, Fred W. Haise, Jr., left, and mission commander James A. Lovell, Jr. walking to T-38 aircraft for training exercise at Patrick AFB.

Apollo 13 astronauts eating breakfast in quarters prior to launch, l-r, Fred W. Haise, Jr., James A. Lovell, Jr., and John L. Swigert.
closeup of Jack Swigert at breakfast on launch day
Lovell's spacesuit
Apollo 13 commander James Lovell during suit-up
John Swigert in the suiting room at Kennedy Space Center prior to launch

A space suit technician talks with Fred Haise during suiting up procedures at Kennedy Space Center
Apollo 13 astronauts, l-r, Fred W. Haise, Jr., lunar module pilot, and James A. Lovell, Jr., commander, during breakfast prior to launch

Apollo 13 astronauts, James A. Lovell, Jr., commander, waving, John L. Swigert, Jr., and Fred W. Haise, Jr., lunar module pilot, walk from Manned Spacecraft Operations Building en route to transfer van for launch
Apollo 13 astronaut, John L. Swigert, Jr., command module pilot, adjusting spacesuit during prelaunch activities
Apollo 13 commander James A. Lovell, Jr. undergoing spacesuit checks prior to launch
Apollo 13 lunar module pilot Fred W. Haise, Jr. smiles during suiting up activities prior to launch
Apollo 13 command module pilot John L. Swigert, Jr. watching technician conduct spacesuit checks during suiting up activities prior to launch
Apollo 13 Commander Jim Lovell during suitup on launch day
Apollo 13 astronauts, front to back, James A. Lovell, Jr., John L. Swigert, Jr., and Fred W. Haise, Jr. suiting up for lunar landing mission.

Apollo 13 astronauts, James A. Lovell, Jr., John L. Swigert, Jr., and Fred W. Haise, Jr. walking along hallway of Manned Spacecraft Operations Building en route to transfer van for launch of lunar landing mission.
Apollo 13 astronauts James A. Lovell, Jr., John L. Swigert, Jr., and Fred W. Haise, Jr. walking to transfer van.
Astronaut secretary Martha Caballero wishing Apollo 13 commander James A. Lovell, Jr. good luck.
Guenter Wendt assists the Apollo 13 crew in the pad white room

The Apollo 13 Saturn V yaws away from the launch tower during liftoff
Gene Kranz watches Apollo 13's 4th TV tranmission with trouble only minutes away.
View of Mission Control Center during the Apollo 13 oxygen cell failure
Deke Slayton (checked jacket) displays the adapter devised to make use of square Command Module lithium hydroxide canisters for removal of excess carbon dioxide from the Apollo 13 LM cabin
Standing in front of the Apollo 9 CM at the Manned Spacecraft Center, Reginald Turnill of the BBC makes a tape for TV transmission back to his home country during the Apollo 13 mission.

The three crewmen of the Apollo 13 mission are photographed during the first day of their post-flight debriefing activity at the Manned Spacecraft Center (MSC)

Apollo 13 crewmembers are photographed during the first day of their post-flight debriefing activity at the MSC; Dr. Donald K. Slayton (center foreground), MSC Director of Flight Crew Operations, talks with Dr. Wernher von Braun (left)

Apollo astronauts & Soyuz 9 crew at a backyard party (left-to-right: Armstrong, Aldrin, Anders, Nikolayev, McDivitt, Conrad, Cunningham, Stafford, Swigert, Gordon, Schweickart, Scott, Lovell, Slayton, Sevastyanov)
